answerText: throat-singing [or Khoomei; or Hooliin Chor; prompt on overtone singing or harmonic sing ing; prompt on overtone chanting] [10] Aficionados of throat-singing in this aforementioned country use melodies passed down by their yurt-dwelling ancestors living in the northern Gobi desert.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 7 | 13 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: Styles of this activity include the high-register sygyt and the more baritone Kargyraa. For 10 points each: [10] Name this style of music popular in the republic of Tuva and the country to its south, whose performers vibrate their vestibular folds.
